docs.lead_paragraph: Richard R. Buery Jr., who is more familiar with starting organizations than taking over established ones, will be the first black leader of the 150-year-old nonprofit organization.

headline.seo: Big Tasks for Richard Buery Jr., New Head of Children’s Aid Society
headline.main: Children’s Aid Society’s New Chief Faces Big Challenges
headline.print_headline: Children’s Aid Society’s New Chief Faces Big Challenges

docs.lead_paragraph: 8 P.M. (HBO) THE SECRET LIFE OF BEES (2008) A teenager with a violent past (Dakota Fanning, right, with Tristan Wilds) runs away with her abusive father's employee (Jennifer Hudson) to an Upcountry town in 1964 South Carolina, where she tries to unlock the secret of her mother's past. Queen Latifah, Alicia Keys and Sophie Okonedo play the beekeeping sisters who take them in. Writing in The New York Times, A. O. Scott said that the film, adapted by Gina Prince-Bythewood from the novel by Sue Monk Kidd, ''insists so strenuously on its themes of redemption, tolerance, love and healing that it winds up defeating itself and robbing Ms. Kidd's already maudlin tale of its melodramatic heat.'' He added, ''You can almost feel how badly it wants to be about the lives, not of bees, but of black women at a pivotal moment in the recent past.'' 10:30 A.M. (13) RELIGION & ETHICS This Season 13 opener explores personal genetic testing and profiles Father Leo Patalinghug, whose Web show, ''Grace Before Meals,'' was created to feed the mind, body and soul.

docs.lead_paragraph: I periodically fulminate over television "news" coverage that is celebrity-driven and makes a wading pool look deep, while ignoring issues of global health and poverty. So let me also praise a milestone in the other direction: NBC Nightly News is planning to do a piece tomorrow night (Friday) about maternal health in Pakistan.

headline.main: When Dying Moms Make the News

docs.abstract: NBC will have a segment on the nightly news about maternal health in Pakistan! Wow -- that's a milestone.
docs.snippet: NBC will have a segment on the nightly news about maternal health in Pakistan! Wow -- that's a milestone.

docs.lead_paragraph: A set of proposed international sex education guidelines by Unesco, aimed at reducing H.I.V. infections among young people, has provoked criticism from conservatives.

docs.lead_paragraph: Kathleen Sebelius, the secretary of health and human services, plans to shine a light Thursday on the particular problems that women face with health insurance. Ms. Sebelius will join a round-table discussion in Portland, Me., with Representative Chellie Pingree, a Maine Democrat, and officials of AARP and the Maine Women's Lobby. Women who are insured through their employers tend to be protected by federal laws that bar sex discrimination. But those who buy insurance in the individual market face a variety of problems.
docs.abstract: Secretary of Health and Human Services Kathleen Sebelius will join round-table discussion in Portland, Maine, that will focus on women's health-insurance problems; panel will address various issues including gender rating, practice allowed by some states in which insurers can charge women of childbearing age more than men; photo (M)
